5.tool_description:
'Pattern Monster' is an API tool which can create customizable SVG patterns for your projects. 
This tool has 1 API:
1. 'Get SVG Pattern' can get an SVG pattern with customizable parameters like name, scale, moveLeft, angle, strokeJoin, moveTop, colors, spacing, stroke.

optional_parameters.name: name
optional_parameters.description:
Name of the pattern specified at https://pattern.monster/api
(Default: Random name if not specified)

optional_parameters.name: scale
optional_parameters.description:
0.5 to Max Scale of the pattern specified at https://pattern.monster/api
(Default: Random scale if not specified)

optional_parameters.name: moveLeft
optional_parameters.description: 0 - 100 ( Default: 0 )

optional_parameters.name: angle
optional_parameters.description: 0 - 360 (Default: Random angle if not specified)

optional_parameters.name: strokeJoin
optional_parameters.description:
round or square 
(Default: round)
Valid only for patterns with Stroke Join as specified at https://pattern.monster/api

optional_parameters.name: moveTop
optional_parameters.description: 0 - 100 ( Default: 0 )

optional_parameters.name: colors
optional_parameters.description:
2 to Max Colors of the pattern specified at https://pattern.monster/api
Format: Color1|Color2|Color3|Color4|Color5
At least, two colors are required if specified
(Default: Random colors if not specified)
Accepted color values: 
CSS colors ( eg. aqua, red )
RGB or RGBA colors ( eg. rgb(59,130,246), rgba(234,179,8,0.7) )
HSL or HSLA colors ( eg. hsl(300, 76%, 72%), hsla(147,50%,47%,0.5) )
HEX colors without the hash symbol ( eg. E11D48, 2563eb )

optional_parameters.name: spacing
optional_parameters.description:
Horizontal Spacing | Vertical Spacing
(Default: 0|0)
Max Spacing of the pattern specified at https://pattern.monster/api
Valid only for patterns with Max Spacing other than 0|0

optional_parameters.name: stroke
optional_parameters.description:
0.5 to Max Stroke of the pattern specified at https://pattern.monster/api
(Default: Random stroke if not specified)
Valid only for patterns with Mode as Stroke

Example.Scenario: if you want to get a customized SVG pattern with name 'waves-1', scale of 1.5, angle of 250 degrees, strokeJoin as 'square', and colors 'aqua' and 'red'

'Cars image background removal' can remove the background from car images. This tool has 2 APIs:
1. 'Get version' can return an actual version of the service in format `vX.Y.Z` where X is the version of API.
2. 'Get list of available modes' can provide three options for background removal results:
* Mask of foreground.
* Image with foreground object.
* Image with foreground object with shadow.

Get version.name: Get version
Get version.description: Returns an actual version of the service in format `vX.Y.Z` where X is the version of API.

Example.Scenario: Get the actual version of the service.

Get list of available modes.name: Get list of available modes
Get list of available modes.description:
The service provides three options for background removal results:
* Mask of foreground.
* Image with foreground object.
* Image with foreground object with shadow.

Example.Scenario: To get the list of available modes for background removal

Remove background from photo of a car an.name: Remove background from photo of a car and return results
Remove background from photo of a car an.description:
Performs actual car image analysis and responds with results.

Image must be a regular JPEG or PNG image (with or without transparency).
Usually such images have extensions: `.jpg`, `.jpeg`, `.png`.
The service checks input file by MIME type and accepts the following types:

* `image/jpeg`
* `image/png`

The size of image file must be less than `16Mb`.

optional_parameters.name: url
optional_parameters.description:
Note: Use this form data field if you want to pass image as a link to a public web resource. If you want to pass image as a binary file, please, use another field named `image`.

Image must be a regular JPEG or PNG image (with or without transparency). Usually such images have extensions: `.jpg`, `.jpeg`, `.png`. The service checks input file by MIME type and accepts the following types:
* `image/jpeg`
* `image/png`

The size of image file must be less than `16Mb`.

optional_parameters.name: image
optional_parameters.description:
Note: Use this form data field if you want to pass image as a binary file. If you want to pass image as a link to a public web resource, please, use another field named `url`.

Image must be a regular JPEG or PNG image (with or without transparency). Usually such images have extensions: `.jpg`, `.jpeg`, `.png`. The service checks input file by MIME type and accepts the following types:
* `image/jpeg`
* `image/png`

The size of image file must be less than `16Mb`.

optional_parameters.name: image-bg
optional_parameters.description:
Optional background image.

If the background image is passed then it's content will be blended below foreground object (aligned by the center). The final output image will have the same size as the main input image (not background image!). Meaningless if the mode is `fg-mask`.

Note: Use this optional form data field if you want to pass background image as a binary file. If you want to pass background image as a link to a public web resource, please, use another field named `url-bg`.

Image must be a regular JPEG or PNG image (with or without transparency). Usually such images have extensions: `.jpg`, `.jpeg`, `.png`. The service checks input file by MIME type and accepts the following types:
* `image/jpeg`
* `image/png`

The size of image file must be less than `16Mb`.

optional_parameters.name: url-bg
optional_parameters.description:
Optional background image.

If the background image is passed then it's content will be blended below foreground object (aligned by the center). The final output image will have the same size as the main input image (not background image!). Meaningless if the mode is `fg-mask`.

Note: Use this form data field if you want to pass image as a link to a public web resource. If you want to pass image as a binary file, please, use another field named `image-bg`.

Image must be a regular JPEG or PNG image (with or without transparency). Usually such images have extensions: `.jpg`, `.jpeg`, `.png`. The service checks input file by MIME type and accepts the following types:
* `image/jpeg`
* `image/png`

The size of image file must be less than `16Mb`.

optional_parameters.name: mode
optional_parameters.description:
Query parameter `mode` is optional and may be used to choose the format of the output image: foreground mask or foreground image. Also the foreground image could be returned with shadow under the object and hidden car license plate (if detected).
By default the service uses `fg-image`.

Available modes and expected content of the resulting image:
* `fg-image` (default) – the image with the foreground object (car). Here the result is a 4-channel (`RGBA`) PNG image where background is transparent. 
    * Areas recognized as car will have the same color values at output image as the original input image.
    * Areas recognized as background will be transparent at output image.
    * Pixels of output image near the car borders may be semi transparent.
* `fg-mask` – the mask of foreground object (car). In this case the result is a single-channel grayscale PNG image.
    * Areas recognized as foreground (car) will have white color.
    * Areas recognized as background will be black at output image.
    * Pixels of output image near to car borders may have gray values: the closer
     to black, the more likely the pixel is the background.
* `fg-image-shadow` – the image with the foreground object (car) and realistic shadow under the car. Image format is as in case of just the foreground object.
* `fg-image-hideclp` – the image with the foreground object (car) with hidden license plate. Image format is as in case of just the foreground object.
* `fg-image-shadow-hideclp` – the image with the foreground object (car) with realistic shadow and hidden license plate. Image format is as in case of just the foreground object.

9.tool_description:
'ProxyPage' can get high quality proxies for free with a proxy list that can be filtered according to specific criteria. 
This tool has 3 APIs:
1. 'Random proxy' can get a random proxy with options to choose the type and country of the proxy.
2. 'Tier2' can obtain a list of proxies with different parameters like type, limit, latency, ssl, is_anonymous and country.
3. 'Tier1' can list tier 1 proxies with filters like type, latency, country, and limit.

Random proxy.name: Random proxy
Random proxy.description:
Get random proxy,

choose type and country

optional_parameters.name: country
optional_parameters.description: You can specify a country for a proxy that you want to be returened

Example.Scenario: If you want to get a random HTTP proxy from the US

Tier2.name: Tier2
Tier2.description:
Tier 2 proxies

Each proxy returned costs 1 credit


With our /v1/tier2 endpoint you can set different parameters for proxies that you need.

You can set type which is just your proxy type, either HTTP, HTTPS, SOCKS4, SOCKS5, CONNECT:25 (which is smtp proxy)

for limit set an integer that will tell us how many proxies you will need. Our users usually set a limit to avoid using too many credits.

With latency you can set an integer which will filter out all proxies that have a latency higher then specified.

ssl is a boolean parameter, you can filter out proxies that support ssl or don't

is_anonymous is also a boolean statemet where you can filter anonymous proxies

country is a parameter that you can use to set a country that you want.

Example.Scenario: if you want to get 100 HTTP proxies with low latency, which are anonymous and support SSL, from the US

Tier1.name: Tier1
Tier1.description:
List our tier 1 proxies with filters
This proxies are more comprehensively checked


You can set type which is just your proxy type, either HTTP, HTTPS

for limit set an integer that will tell us how many proxies you will need. Our users usually set a limit to avoid using too many credits.

With latency you can set an integer which will filter out all proxies that have a latency higher then specified.

ssl is a boolean parameter, you can filter out proxies that support ssl or don't

is_anonymous is also a boolean statemet where you can filter anonymous proxies

country is a parameter that you can use to set a country that you want.

optional_parameters.name: latency
optional_parameters.description: ms latency for a proxy, everything that is below that value is returned

optional_parameters.name: country
optional_parameters.description: You can specify a country for a proxy that you want to be returened

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Limit the number of proxies returned, helps you control how many credits can be used

Example.Scenario: if you want to get HTTP type tier 1 proxies from US with a limit of 100 proxies

18.tool_description:
'Transportistas de Argentina' can provide offices, locations, and prices for your shipments in Argentina for Andreani, Oca, and Correo Argentino.
This tool has 9 APIs:
1. '/tracking/correo_argentino/result_task/:task_id' can give the result for one Task ID.
2. '/cities/states/:stateIsoCode' can give a list of cities for an ISO state.
3. '/cities/postcode/:stateIsoCode/:postCode' can give a list of cities for an ISO state and postcode.
4. '/cities/search/:stateIsoCode/:keyword' can search for a city for a specific ISO state and keyword name.
5. '/cities/states' can give a list of states for Argentina with ISO code.
6. '/quotes/city/correo_argentino/:weight/:stateIsoCodeSrc/:normalizeCityNameSrc/:stateIsoCodeDst/:normalizeCityNameDst' can give a list of quotes for ISO state and city keyword name in Correo Argentino.
7. '/quotes/postcode/oca/:cuit/:operativa/:cost/:weight/:volume/:postCodeSrc/:postCodeDst' can give a quote for postcode in OCA e-Pack.
8. '/quotes/postcode/correo_argentino/:weight/:postCodeSrc/:postCodeDst' can give a list of quotes for postcode in Correo Argentino.
9. '/offices/postcode/:service/:postCode' can give a list of offices for an ISO state and postcode.
10. '/offices/search/:service/:stateIsoCode/:keyword' can give a list of offices for an ISO state and postcode.

Example.Scenario: Get the result of task ID '12345' for Correo Argentino tracking

25.tool_description:
'Wayback Machine' can support a number of different APIs to make it easier for developers to retrieve information about Wayback capture data.
This tool has 1 API:
1. 'Availability' is a simple API for Wayback that tests if a given URL is archived and currently accessible in the Wayback Machine. This API is useful for providing a 404 or other error handler which checks Wayback to see if it has an archived copy ready to display. The API can be used as follows:

Availability.name: Availability
Availability.description: This simple API for Wayback is a test to see if a given url is archived and currenlty accessible in the Wayback Machine. This API is useful for providing a 404 or other error handler which checks Wayback to see if it has an archived copy ready to display. The API can be used as follows:

optional_parameters.name: timestamp
optional_parameters.description: timestamp is the timestamp to look up in Wayback. If not specified, the most recenty available capture in Wayback is returned. The format of the timestamp is 1-14 digits (YYYYMMDDhhmmss)

optional_parameters.name: callback
optional_parameters.description: callback is an optional callback which may be specified to produce a JSONP response.

Example.Scenario: To check if the url http://mashape.com is archived and currently accessible in the Wayback Machine with timestamp 20220101 and a callback function named 'myFunction'

27.tool_description:
'Geolocation Simulation For Mobile Apps' can provide a REST API for testing geolocation-based mobile apps. With this tool, users can test their app in random areas (geofences), random streets, and see how their app would work if a user is walking or driving around with it. Use their web platform to buy API credits at https://apps.geolocationtech.com/login.

30.tool_description:
'Ephemeral Proxies' can provide datacenter and residential proxies. This service contains pools of stable and high-quality proxies that automatically rotate to ensure that you get a new different proxy with each API call. Each request to this API service will provide you with a new proxy available for 30 mins. Proxies are constantly monitored to ensure their health. You can extend the allocation time of a datacenter proxy by making successive calls to the API.
This tool has 5 APIs:
1. 'Check datacenter proxies service status' can return the current status of the service, including the total number of datacenter proxies available and grouped by country.
2. 'Obtain a new datacenter proxy' can provide you with a new datacenter proxy that is available for 30 mins. The proxy will allow connections from the same source IP as the one making this API call.
3. 'Extend expiration time of a datacenter proxy' can extend the expiration time of an already allocated datacenter proxy by 30 mins.
4. 'Get user's traffic balance' can return the user's traffic balance for the current monthly subscription.
5. 'Obtain a new residential proxy' can provide you with a new residential proxy that is available for 30 mins. The proxy will allow connections from the same source IP as the one making this API call.

Check residential proxies service status.name: Check residential proxies service status
Check residential proxies service status.description: It returns the current status of the service, including the total number of residential proxies available and grouped by country.

Example.Scenario: To check the status of the residential proxies service

Obtain a new residential proxy.name: Obtain a new residential proxy
Obtain a new residential proxy.description:
The connection proxy details are `proxy.host` and `proxy.port` from the response fields.
The proxy will allow connections from the same source IP as the one making this API call. Make use of the `whitelist_ip` parameter to allow an additional ip.
Countries can be selected by using the `countries` parameter, otherwise the country is randomly selected. A list of countries is available on *Service Status* endpoint.
The proxy is available for 30 mins.

optional_parameters.name: countries
optional_parameters.description:
List of countries, separate it by comma, that you would like the proxies to be located.
Example: GB,US,PL,RU

optional_parameters.name: whitelist_ip
optional_parameters.description:
The proxy that this endpoint returns will allow connections from the source ip that is making this API call.
Additionally, you can allow an extra ip to connect to the proxy by setting this parameter to the ip that you would like to whitelist.
The list of ips that the proxy has whitelisted is returned in the API response.

Example.Scenario: To obtain a new residential proxy with location in GB, US, PL, and RU and whitelist an extra IP address 10.0.0.1 for connection to the proxy

Check datacenter proxies service status.name: Check datacenter proxies service status
Check datacenter proxies service status.description: It returns the current status of the service, including the total number of datacenter proxies available and grouped by country.

Example.Scenario: Check the status of the datacenter proxies service

Obtain a new datacenter proxy.name: Obtain a new datacenter proxy
Obtain a new datacenter proxy.description:
The connection proxy details are `proxy.host` and `proxy.port` from the response fields.
The proxy will allow connections from the same source IP as the one making this API call. Make use of the `whitelist_ip` parameter to allow an additional ip.
Countries can be selected by using the `countries` parameter, otherwise the country is randomly selected. A list of countries is available on *Service Status* endpoint.
The proxy is available for 30 mins.

optional_parameters.name: whitelist_ip
optional_parameters.description:

Additionally, you can allow an extra ip to connect to the proxy by setting this parameter to the ip that you would like to whitelist.
The list of ips that the proxy has whitelisted is returned in the API response.

Example: GB,US,PL,RU

Get user's traffic balance.name: Get user's traffic balance
Get user's traffic balance.description: It returns the user's traffic balance for current monthly subscription.

Example.Scenario: To get the user's traffic balance for the current monthly subscription.

Extend expiration time of a datacenter p.name: Extend expiration time of a datacenter proxy
Extend expiration time of a datacenter p.description:

33.tool_description:
'QR Code Generator API_v6' can generate QR codes within applications. This tool has 1 API:
1. 'QR Code Image Generator' can generate QR codes for a variety of purposes, such as contact information, links, payments, events, and coupons. Overall, a QR code generator API is a versatile tool that can help businesses and individuals streamline their processes and improve the user experience for their customers.

QR Code Image Generator.name: QR Code Image Generator
QR Code Image Generator.description:
A QR code generator API is a tool that enables developers to generate QR codes within their applications. QR codes are two-dimensional barcodes that can be scanned using a smartphone camera and decoded using QR code reader software. The API allows developers to easily integrate QR code generation functionality into their existing applications, such as mobile apps, web apps, and software.

This API can be used to generate QR codes for a variety of purposes, such as:

Contact information: Generate a QR code containing your contact information, such as your phone number or email address.
Links: Create a QR code that links to a website, YouTube video, or other online content.
Payments: Create a QR code for making payments through a mobile wallet or payment app.
Events: Generate a QR code for an event, such as a concert or conference, to provide attendees with all the necessary information.
Coupons: Create a QR code for a coupon or promo code to be redeemed at a physical store or online.
Overall, a QR code generator API is a versatile tool that can help businesses and individuals streamline their processes and improve the user experience for their customers.

Example.Scenario: Generate a QR code for the website 'https://rapidapi.com'

34.tool_description:
'YouTube MP3' can convert YouTube videos to MP3. 
This tool has 1 API:
1. 'Get MP3' can convert to MP3 at the default bit rate. The quota cost will apply according to the length of the MP3 file. The optional 'cut' parameter can be used to cut the MP3 according to the provided 'sStart' and 'sEnd' parameters.

Get MP3.name: Get MP3
Get MP3.description:
Convert to MP3 at the default bit rate.
Quota cost will apply according to the length of the mp3 file.

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description:
Quota cost will apply according to the length of the mp3 file.
Quota is calculated as follows:
if length <= 30 then 1
if 30 < length <= 60 then 2
if 60 < length <= 90 then 3
if 90 < length <= 120 then 4
if 120 < length <= 150 then 5
if 150 < length <= 180 then 6

optional_parameters.name: cut
optional_parameters.description:
Cut the mp3 according to the provided sStart and sEnd parameters
The value must be provided as 1
The quota Cost is +1.

optional_parameters.name: sStart
optional_parameters.description:
Starting point for cutting the mp3.
Format must be HH:MM:SS

optional_parameters.name: sEnd
optional_parameters.description:
End point for cutting the mp3.
Format must be HH:MM:SS

Example.Scenario: if you want to convert the video with ID 'UxxajLWwzqY' to MP3 without cutting it

optional_parameters.name: base64_encoded
optional_parameters.description:
**We recommend that you always set** `base64_encoded` **to** `true` **and send [Base64](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Base64) encoded data to Judge0.**

If submission’s `source_code`, `stdin`, or `expected_output` contains non-printable characters or characters which cannot be sent with JSON, then set the `base64_encoded` parameter to `true` and send these attributes Base64 encoded. Your responsibility is to encode each of the mentioned attributes (`source_code`, `stdin`, and `expected_output`) even if just one of them contains non-printable characters. By default, this parameter is set to `false` and Judge0 assumes you are sending plain text data.

Create a Submission.name: Create a Submission
Create a Submission.description: Creates new submission. Created submission waits in queue to be processed. On successful creation, you are returned a submission token which can be used to check submission status.

optional_parameters.name: fields
optional_parameters.description:
Return only the desired submission attributes. The default value for the `fields` parameter is `stdout,time,memory,stderr,token,compile_output,message,status`.

Use `*` to receive all available attributes.

optional_parameters.name: wait
optional_parameters.description:
Set to `true` to turn on **synchronous** mode to get the submission result immediately as a response. 

Please note that synchronous execution might be slightly slower than asynchronous.

optional_parameters.name: base64_encoded
optional_parameters.description:
**We recommend that you always set** `base64_encoded` **to** `true` **and send [Base64](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Base64) encoded data to Judge0.**

If submission’s `source_code`, `stdin`, or `expected_output` contains non-printable characters or characters which cannot be sent with JSON, then set the `base64_encoded` parameter to `true` and send these attributes Base64 encoded. Your responsibility is to encode each of the mentioned attributes (`source_code`, `stdin`, and `expected_output`) even if just one of them contains non-printable characters. By default, this parameter is set to `false` and Judge0 assumes you are sending plain text data.

optional_parameters.name: base64_encoded
optional_parameters.description:
**We recommend that you always set** `base64_encoded` **to** `true` **and send [Base64](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Base64) encoded data to Judge0.**

If submission’s `source_code`, `stdin`, or `expected_output` contains non-printable characters or characters which cannot be sent with JSON, then set the `base64_encoded` parameter to `true` and send these attributes Base64 encoded. Your responsibility is to encode each of the mentioned attributes (`source_code`, `stdin`, and `expected_output`) even if just one of them contains non-printable characters. By default, this parameter is set to `false` and Judge0 assumes you are sending plain text data.

Create a Submission.name: Create a Submission
Create a Submission.description: Creates new submission. Created submission waits in queue to be processed. On successful creation, you are returned a submission token which can be used to check submission status.

optional_parameters.name: fields
optional_parameters.description:
Return only the desired submission attributes. The default value for the `fields` parameter is `stdout,time,memory,stderr,token,compile_output,message,status`.

Use `*` to receive all available attributes.

optional_parameters.name: base64_encoded
optional_parameters.description:
**We recommend that you always set** `base64_encoded` **to** `true` **and send [Base64](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Base64) encoded data to Judge0.**

If submission’s `source_code`, `stdin`, or `expected_output` contains non-printable characters or characters which cannot be sent with JSON, then set the `base64_encoded` parameter to `true` and send these attributes Base64 encoded. Your responsibility is to encode each of the mentioned attributes (`source_code`, `stdin`, and `expected_output`) even if just one of them contains non-printable characters. By default, this parameter is set to `false` and Judge0 assumes you are sending plain text data.

optional_parameters.name: wait
optional_parameters.description:
Set to `true` to turn on **synchronous** mode to get the submission result immediately as a response. 

Please note that synchronous execution might be slightly slower than asynchronous.

83.tool_description:
'Premium-Anime-Mobile-Wallpapers-Illustrations' can fetch the best quality anime mobile wallpapers & illustrations from the 100k+ collection. It allows easy search based on requirements which are categorized by illustrations, anime name, premium, and genre (Boy, Christmas, Couple, Halloween, Family, Valentine, Wedding) with sensitivity control. This tool has 12 APIs:
1. 'Random Wallpapers' can get a random anime wallpaper.
2. 'Anime Wallpapers by pagination' can get anime wallpapers by pagination.
3. 'Anime wallpapers related to the valentine by pagination' can get anime wallpapers related to the valentine by pagination.
4. 'Anime wallpapers related to the wedding by pagination' can get anime wallpapers related to the wedding by pagination.
5. 'Anime wallpapers related to the couple by pagination' can get anime wallpapers related to the couple by pagination.
6. 'Anime wallpapers related to the christmas with pagination' can get anime wallpapers related to the christmas with pagination.
7. 'Anime Illustrations by pagination' can get anime illustrations made by anime fans by pagination.
8. 'Recent Wallpapers by pagination' can get recent anime wallpapers without any categorization by pagination.
9. 'Search by animename, art_id' can search for anime wallpapers by animename or art_id.
10. 'Anime boy wallpapers by pagination' can get anime boy wallpapers by pagination.
11. 'Anime wallpapers related to the family by pagination' can get anime wallpapers related to the family by pagination.
12. 'Premium anime wallpapers by pagination' can get premium anime wallpapers by pagination.

Random Wallpapers.name: Random Wallpapers
Random Wallpapers.description:
Get a random anime wallpaper

Optional GET parameter
**quality**:0

This API provides two types of wallpaper images
1. Compress lower size wallpaper.
2.  Best quality but will result in high size.

if the **quality**  parameter, is not provided then by default it will provide the URL of compressed wallpaper low size if the quality parameter is set to 1 then it will provide a URL of the highest quality wallpaper ( high size ).

**RESPONSE**
**animename**  ( Depend on subscription )
if the wallpaper is related to any anime, or game then the Japanese name of the anime will be sent otherwise illustration will be sent.

**arturl**
URL of wallpaper

**sensitivity** ( Depend on subscription )
Is wallpaper sensitive, 1 means yes 0 means no

**art_id** ( Depend on subscription )
Unique wallpaper  id which can be later used to get more info

**premium** (Depend on subscription)
Whether art is of premium category 1 means yes 0 means no.

**Note: if no wallpaper found response will be**
`{"status": "empty"}`

Example.Scenario: if you want to fetch a random anime wallpaper with the best quality

**sensitivity**: 1
On the above **page**, 1 means it will fetch the latest 10 wallpaper if the page value is 2 then It will bring the next 10 latest wallpaper

Search by animename, art_id

Required GET parameter

**page**: 1
**sensitivity**: 1

**exact**: 0

On the above **page**, 1 means it will fetch the latest 10 wallpaper if the page value is 2 then It will bring the next 10 latest wallpaper
page 1 : 0-10
page 2: 10-20 ……

On the above **sensitivity**, 1 means it will not fetch any 18+ or ecchi-related images if the value is 0 then it will bring all without any filter.

On the above **searchText**, means it will try to fetch all arts based on the above text (Japanese anime name)
OR
art_id

***Note: searchText param should be min 3 chars length***

Optional GET parameter
**exact**: 

If the exact parameter is not provided then by default it will be set to 0.
0 represents fetch all the arts related to any searchText word of animename.

**Note: Exact params value 0 assume that you are passing japanese animename it will search all the wallpapers related to it**
( So **attack on t** will result in empty response since its english name but **Shingeki no** will not)

1 represents fetch all the arts which have the same animename and searchText.

**Note: Exact params value 1 support both english and japanese animename**
( So **Attack on titan** which is english will result wallpaper of japanese animename **Shingeki no Kyojin**)

2 represent fetch arts based on art_id ( so If you are sending art_id on searchText make sure you set the exact param to 2 )

**quality**:0

86.tool_description:
'MoviesDatabase' can provide complete and updated data for over 9 million titles (movies, series, and episodes) and 11 million actors/crew and cast members.
This tool has 15 APIs:
1. '/titles/utils/genres' can return the list of genres available in the database.
2. '/titles/utils/lists' can return the list of available lists to filter titles.
3. '/titles/search/akas/{aka}' can search for titles by title (aka).
4. '/titles/search/keyword/{keyword}' can search for titles by keyword.
5. '/titles/search/title/{title}' can search for titles by exact title.
6. '/actors/random' can return a random actor from the database.
7. '/actors/{id}' can return information about an actor by their IMDb ID.
8. '/titles/utils/titleTypes' can return the list of title types available in the database.
9. '/actors' can return a list of all actors in the database.
10. '/titles/series/{seriesId}' can return information about a series by their IMDb ID.
11. '/titles/x/upcoming' can return the list of upcoming titles.
12. '/titles/{id}/ratings' can return ratings for a title by their IMDb ID.
13. '/titles/{id}/crew' can return the crew for a title by their IMDb ID.
14. '/titles/series/{seriesId}/{season}' can return information about a season of a series by their IMDb ID.
15. '/titles/{id}/aka' can return the alternate titles for a title by their IMDb ID.

Example.Scenario: retrieve all available movie genres
Get all available lists of titles from MoviesDatabase

92.tool_description:
'Website Screenshot or Thumbnail' can take pixel-perfect screenshots or thumbnails of any website. Restpack Screenshot API is an easy to use RESTful web service that can capture screenshots of live web pages and deliver the results in several formats. The service sits on a fully functional browser rendering engine with rich html / css / js capabilities.
This tool has 1 API:
1. '/capture' can capture screenshot from any URL or Raw HTML and deliver it in several formats. We can also provide a custom view port, thumbnail width/height, and delay time.

/capture.name: /capture
/capture.description: Capture screenshot from any URL or Raw HTML. POST method is also available. Please take a look https://restpack.io/screenshot/docs

optional_parameters.name: html
optional_parameters.description:
Raw HTML string of a page that you want to capture. Example:

Test

optional_parameters.name: json
optional_parameters.description: Return a JSON response with the resulting image's URL instead of the image itself. Default: false

optional_parameters.name: mode
optional_parameters.description: Capturing mode. Please see below for details. Default: fullpage Pattern: fullpage | viewport | element

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description: Preferred image output format. If you need a raw html string you can pass html as format Default: png Pattern: jpg | png | pdf | html

optional_parameters.name: width
optional_parameters.description: Preferred viewport width in pixels. Default: 1280 Min: 320 Max: 2000

optional_parameters.name: height
optional_parameters.description: Preferred viewport height in pixels. Default: 1024 Min: 160

optional_parameters.name: thumbnail_width
optional_parameters.description: In case you want a thumbnail image, provide a preferred width. Min: 10 Max: 3000

optional_parameters.name: thumbnail_height
optional_parameters.description: Preferred thumbnail height, requires thumbnail_width to be set, unbounded if omitted. Min: 10 Max: 3000

optional_parameters.name: css
optional_parameters.description: Additional CSS string to be injected into the page before render.

optional_parameters.name: js
optional_parameters.description: Additional JS string to be injected into the page before render.

optional_parameters.name: prescroll
optional_parameters.description: Force scrolling the webpage before capture. Might help with dynamic loading assets.

optional_parameters.name: delay
optional_parameters.description: Time in milliseconds to delay capture after page load. Default: 2000 Max: 10000

optional_parameters.name: ttl
optional_parameters.description: Time in milliseconds for the resulting image to be cached for further requests. Default: 1 day Max: 1 week

optional_parameters.name: fresh
optional_parameters.description: Force rendering a new screenshot disregarding the cache status. Default: false

optional_parameters.name: user_agent
optional_parameters.description: Custom user-agent header string for the web request. Default: Chrome Compatible User Agent

optional_parameters.name: accept_language
optional_parameters.description: Custom accept-language header string for the web request.

optional_parameters.name: element_selector
optional_parameters.description: A CSS selector to be used with element rendering mode.

optional_parameters.name: headers
optional_parameters.description: Additional headers seperated with newline Example: X-Test: header\nAccept-Type: html

optional_parameters.name: retina
optional_parameters.description: Generate retina sized screen capture (2x device pixel ratio). Default: false

optional_parameters.name: base64
optional_parameters.description: Serialize response file to base64

optional_parameters.name: access_token
optional_parameters.description: You can provide your token via querystring instead of header.

optional_parameters.name: url
optional_parameters.description: The URL of web page, including the protocol that you want to capture.

Example.Scenario: if you want to capture a screenshot of google.com with a preferred viewport width of 1280 pixels and a preferred viewport height of 1024 pixels in png format

96.tool_description:
'QRickit QR Code QReator' can dynamically generate QR Codes (URL, Calendar Events, Contact, Text, Email, etc,) for integration in your own website, applications, and other business or personal usage.
This tool has 1 API:
1. 'Generate a QR Code image' can format a GET request to generate a QR Code image. It can take in data for QR Code (e.g. URL, text, vCard data, iCal data, etc.) and generate the QR Code in different types of images such as png, jpg or gif. It also has optional parameters to add logo text, specify the size of the image, set an error correction level, add a footer text, and change the color of the background and text.

Generate a QR Code image.name: Generate a QR Code image
Generate a QR Code image.description: Format of GET request to generate QR Code image. See documentation at https://qrickit.com/qrickit_apps/qrickit_api.php

required_parameters.name: d
required_parameters.description: Data for QR Code (e.g. URL, text, vCard data, iCal data, etc.) See documentation at https://qrickit.com/qrickit_apps/qrickit_api.php for instructions.

optional_parameters.name: logotext
optional_parameters.description: Header Text: logotext=Any text about 15 to 35 characters maximum depending on the size of your QR Code. Color of header text is the same as QR Code color (fgdcolor). In cases where data is very large, text will not fit and should not be used. Text can be urlencoded to avoid problems with special characters.

optional_parameters.name: t
optional_parameters.description: Type of generated image. p = png (default). j = jpg. g = gif.

optional_parameters.name: fgdcolor
optional_parameters.description: QR Code Color: fgdcolor=The color of your QR Code expressed in HTML Hex# (i.e. FFFFFF for white, 000000 for black, etc.). If nothing is specified, the default is black (000000).

optional_parameters.name: qrsize
optional_parameters.description: Size of image in pixels. Default = 150 (i.e. 150 pixel square) . Min = 80. Max = 1480.

optional_parameters.name: lang
optional_parameters.description: Set to "jp" if your optional footer text (addtext) uses Japanese characters. Otherwise leave blank.

optional_parameters.name: e
optional_parameters.description: Error Correction: e=The level of error correction capability. The choices are L (Low) 7%, M (Medium) 15%, Q (Quartile) 25%, and H (High) 30% represented as l, m, q, and h respectively. If nothing is specified, the default error correction level is M (Medium). The higher the error correction means more of the QR Code can still be read if it is damaged (or covered/hidden). However, the higher the error correction, the less data the QR Code can hold.  Usually you don't have to specify anything here unless you have a lot of data to fit in the QR Code. Then you can choose e=L (Low).

optional_parameters.name: addtext
optional_parameters.description: Footer Text: addtext=Any text about 15 to 60 characters maximum depending on the size of your QR Code. In cases where data is very large, text will not fit an d should not be used. Text can be urlencoded to avoid problems with special characters. If using Japanese characters please set "lang" parameter to "jp" (i.e. lang=jp). Otherwise leave "lang" blank.

optional_parameters.name: txtcolor
optional_parameters.description: Footer Text Color: txtcolor=The color of your optional footer text expressed in HTML Hex# (i.e. FFFFFF for white, 000000 for black, etc.). If nothing is specified, the default is black (000000).

optional_parameters.name: bgdcolor
optional_parameters.description: Background Color: bgdcolor=The color of the background expressed in HTML Hex# (i.e. FFFFFF for white, 000000 for black, etc.). If nothing is specified, the default is white (FFFFFF).

Example.Scenario: if you want to generate a QR Code image of a URL 'https://www.example.com' with PNG image type, black QR Code color, and default size

97.tool_description:
'Streaming Availability' can lookup which shows are available on streaming services across 60 countries. 
This tool has 7 APIs: 
1. 'Search Ultra' can search through the catalog of the given services in the given country. Provides filters such as show language, genre and keyword. Items per page is 25. Output includes all the information about the shows, such as title, IMDb ID, TMDb ID, IMDb rating, link to shows' pages in streaming services (including individual season/episode links), cast, runtime, poster and many more! Apart from the info about the given country-service combinations, output also includes information about availability in the other services for the given country. 
2. 'Search Basic (FREE)' can search through the catalog of the given services in the given country. Provides filters such as show language, genre and keyword. Items per page is 8. Output includes all the information about the shows, such as title, IMDb ID, TMDb ID, IMDb rating, link to shows' pages in streaming services (including individual season/episode links), cast, runtime, poster and many more! Apart from the info about the given country-service combinations, output also includes information about availability in the other services for the given country. 
3. 'Services (FREE)' can get the list of supported services and details about them. 
4. 'Get Basic (FREE)' can get the details of a show via IMDb or TMDb id, including the streaming availability info in the given country. 
5. 'Search Pro' can search through the catalog of the given services in the given country. Provides filters such as show language, genre and keyword. Items per page is 10. Output includes all the information about the shows, such as title, IMDb ID, TMDb ID, IMDb rating, link to shows' pages in streaming services (including individual season/episode links), cast, runtime, poster and many more! Apart from the info about the given country-service combinations, output also includes information about availability in the other services for the given country. 
6. 'Get Ultra' can get the details of a show via IMDb or TMDb id, including the global streaming availability info. 
7. 'Search By Title (FREE)' can search movies and series by title. Maximum amount of items returned are 20, unless there are more than 20 shows with the exact given title input. In that case all the items have 100% match with the title will be returned. No pagination is supported.

Search Ultra.name: Search Ultra
Search Ultra.description: Search through the catalog of the given services in the given country. Provides filters such as show language, genre and keyword. Items per page is 25. Output includes all the information about the shows, such as title, IMDb ID, TMDb ID, IMDb rating, link to shows' pages in streaming services (including individual season/episode links), cast, runtime, poster and many more! Apart from the info about the given country-service combinations, output also includes information about availability in the other services for the given country.

required_parameters.name: services
required_parameters.description: A comma separated list of up to 16 services to search in. See `/v2/services` endpoint to get the supported services and their ids/names.

required_parameters.name: country
required_parameters.description: 2 letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code of the country to search in. See the about page to check the supported countries.

optional_parameters.name: order_by
optional_parameters.description:
Determines the ordering of the results.

Possible values are `original_title`, `imdb_vote_count`, `imdb_rating` and `year`. Default value is `original_title`

optional_parameters.name: max_imdb_rating
optional_parameters.description: Out of 100

optional_parameters.name: min_imdb_rating
optional_parameters.description: Out of 100

optional_parameters.name: desc
optional_parameters.description:
Use descending order?

Possible values are `true` and `false`. Default value is `false`.

optional_parameters.name: keyword
optional_parameters.description: A keyword to only search within the shows have that keyword in their overview or title.

optional_parameters.name: cursor
optional_parameters.description:
Cursor is used for pagination. After each request, the response includes a `hasMore` boolean field to tell if there are more results that did not fit the returned list size. If it is set as true, to get the rest of the result set, send a new request (with the same parameters for other fields such as show_type, services etc.), and set the cursor parameter as the `nextCursor` value of the previous request response. Do not forget to escape the cursor value before putting it into the query as it might contain characters such as `?`, `&`.

The first request naturally does not require a `cursor` parameter.

optional_parameters.name: year_max
optional_parameters.description: Maximum release/air year of the show.

optional_parameters.name: year_min
optional_parameters.description: Minimum release/air year of the show.

optional_parameters.name: show_original_language
optional_parameters.description: A 2 letter ISO 639-1 language code to only search within the shows whose original language matches with the provided language.

optional_parameters.name: genres_relation
optional_parameters.description:
When more than one genre is supplied in `genres` parameter, `genres_relation` chooses the matching style against

When `or`, the endpoint returns any show that has at least one of the given genres.
When `and`, it only returns the shows that have all of the given genres.

Default value is `and`.

optional_parameters.name: genres
optional_parameters.description:
Comma separated list of genre ids to only search within the shows in those genres. See `/v2/genres` endpoint to see available genres and ids.

When more than one genre supplied, set `genres_relation` parameter to specify between returning shows that have at least one of the given genres or returning shows that have all of the given genres

optional_parameters.name: output_language
optional_parameters.description: 2 letter iso code of the output language. Default is `en`. See the about page to see the list of languages supported.

optional_parameters.name: show_type
optional_parameters.description: Type of shows to search in. Accepted values are `movie`, `series` or `all`. The default value is `all`.

Example.Scenario: if you want to search for movies available on Netflix, Prime (buy option), Hulu (with HBO addon), and Peacock (free shows) in the United States, having a maximum IMDB vote count of 1000000, ordered by year in descending order, with maximum IMDB rating of 90 and minimum of 70, released between the years 2000 and 2025, and having either of the genres with ids 18 or 80

This tool has 2 APIs:
1. 'Shoot thumbnail' issues a reset API call if refresh is set to 1. Else it will download if the image is ready.
2. 'Thumbnail ready' polls this API until it returns that the image is available. If available, you can download through endpoint 1. Rendering an image depends largely on how fast a particular web page is loaded (and if it contains Flash). Average waiting time is around 20 - 60 seconds.

2. Thumbnail ready.name: 2. Thumbnail ready
2. Thumbnail ready.description: Poll this API until it returns that the image is available.  If available, you can download through endpoint 1. 143.tool_description:
'Ubidots' can simplify the making of Internet of Things applications for data capturing, real-time remote monitoring and getting insights from sensor data.
This tool has 6 APIs:
1. 'GET /datasources/{datasource_id}/variables' can list the variables of a specified data source, showing all the fields of the variables.
2. 'GET /variables/{variable_id}' can return a variable and its details. It shows additional fields than the ones required during the creation of the variable: last_value: Shows the last value written to the variable.
3. 'GET /variables' can retrieve the list of all the variables owned by a user. The header X-Auth-Token is needed to have the permissions for this endpoint.
4. 'GET /datasources' can list all the existing data sources of a user.
5. 'GET /datasources/{datasource_id}' can obtain an existing data source and its details. Also, it returns additional fields besides the ones required during the creation of the data source: number_of_variables: Shows the number of variables contained by the data source. last_activity: Returns the date of the last activity.
6. 'GET /variables/{variable_id}/values' can return the values of the specified variable. Every value will have a timestamp which is a value in milliseconds according to the POSIX standard.

GET /datasources/{datasource_id}/variabl.name: GET /datasources/{datasource_id}/variables
GET /datasources/{datasource_id}/variabl.description: This resource list the variables of a specified data source, showing all the fields of the variables.

Example.Scenario: if you want to list the variables of a specified data source with datasource_id 'abc123'

GET /variables/{variable_id}.name: GET /variables/{variable_id}
GET /variables/{variable_id}.description: This resource returns a variable and its details. It shows additional fields than the ones required during the creation of the variable:  last_value: Shows the last value written to the variable.

Example.Scenario: if you want to get the details of a variable with variable ID '1234567890' in Ubidots

GET /variables.name: GET /variables
GET /variables.description: Retrieves the list of all the variables owned by a user. The header X-Auth-Token is needed to have the permissions for this endpoint.

Example.Scenario: if you want to retrieve the list of all variables owned by a user

GET /datasources.name: GET /datasources
GET /datasources.description: This resource lists all the existing data sources of a user.

Example.Scenario: if you want to list all the existing data sources of a user

GET /datasources/{datasource_id}.name: GET /datasources/{datasource_id}
GET /datasources/{datasource_id}.description: This resource obtains an existing data source and its details. Also, it returns additional fields besides the ones required during the creation of the data source:  number_of_variables: Shows the number of variables contained by the data source. last_activity: Returns the date of the last activity

Example.Scenario: if you want to obtain the details of an existing data source with datasource_id '1234567890'

GET /variables/{variable_id}/values.name: GET /variables/{variable_id}/values
GET /variables/{variable_id}/values.description: This resource returns the values of the specified variable.  Every value will have a timestamp which is a value in milliseconds according to the POSIX standard.

Example.Scenario: If you want to get the values of a variable with variable_id 'abc123' in Ubidots

POST /variables/{variable_id}/values.name: POST /variables/{variable_id}/values
POST /variables/{variable_id}/values.description: This resource creates a new value within the specified variable. Every value has a timestamp that can be either specified manually by the device, or automatically by the server.

POST /datasources.name: POST /datasources
POST /datasources.description: This resource creates a new data source. Every data source owns a number of variables, and has a context with different attributes. For example, a data source called “Delivery Truck” can have a attributes like {“City”: “Boston”} or {“Type”: “Truck”}.  Attributes are not meant to change dynamically over time, but to add a “relational” layer to your data sources.

POST /datasources/{datasource_id}/variab.name: POST /datasources/{datasource_id}/variables
POST /datasources/{datasource_id}/variab.description: This resource creates a new variable within the specified data source. You can assign tags to variables (i.e. “room”, “yard”), and also properties with atributes, for example: {“Color”: “Blue”} or {“Status”: “OFF”}

POST /collections/values.name: POST /collections/values
POST /collections/values.description: This resource allow the create a value for multiple variables. Every value has a timestamp that can be either specified manually by the device, or automatically by the server.

POST-video.name: POST-video
POST-video.description:
To create a video, you create its metadata first, then you upload contents.

A video is public by default.
### Creating a video Container for future upload
```shell
$ curl https://ws.api.video/videos \
-H 'Authorization: Bearer {access_token} \
-d '{"title":"My video", 
     "description":"so many details",
     "mp4Support":true
}'
```

### Creating a hosted video 

You can also create a video directly from one hosted on a third-party server by giving its URI in `source` parameter:

```shell
$ curl https://ws.api.video/videos \
-H 'Authorization: Bearer {access_token} \
-d '{"source":"http://uri/to/video.mp4", "title":"My video"}'
```

In this case, the service will respond `202 Accepted` and download the video asynchronously.

 We have tutorials on:
 [Creating and uploading videos](https://api.video/blog/tutorials/video-upload-tutorial)
[Uploading large videos](https://api.video/blog/tutorials/video-upload-tutorial-large-videos)
[Using tags with videos](https://api.video/blog/tutorials/video-tagging-best-practices)
[Private videos](https://api.video/blog/tutorials/tutorial-private-videos)

POST_live-streams.name: POST_live-streams
POST_live-streams.description: See our [Live Stream Tutorial](https://api.video/blog/tutorials/live-stream-tutorial) for a walkthrough of this API with OBS.

POST_auth-api-key.name: POST_auth-api-key
POST_auth-api-key.description:
The first action taken when interacting with api.video is the authentication step (NOTE: this is abstracted in many of the SDKs).

To Authenticate, you must submit your API key.  Upon authentication, api.video will return an access_token that is valid for one hour (3600 seconds).

View a [tutorial](https://api.video/blog/tutorials/authentication-tutorial) on authentication.  

Example request/response:
```bash
curl -X POST \
https://sandbox.api.video/auth/api-key \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-d '{"apiKey": "your_api_key"}'```

 ```json {
    "token_type": "Bearer",
    "expires_in": 3600,
    "access_token": "eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsImp0aSI6ImFiYjcxNmNiY2ZiNmY4MDc2OWEzZmQ1MjlhMjZiZWRkY2EwMzhlYzA3NDk5M2ZiMTA0YjhiZGMwOTI5MzgxN2M3NmNkNzI4ZDIzOGMzZmNlIn0..jWHC18iEur69FzD5dm78wAwNzh2cPKTRvKuspyQNQKPvhEbYa2v4XhqVNh0TTw8JeNxBtcePBTMHl4S9nWsw7pW4KD8zbqzUjCZNYlaYDpu8vu_tmWVO2JccglJIjuQEaiTbkUsfLdgtsb_9DJ3frk1-WgAKuzu0HewhcGb80xivdJPqNYA6I1Ig8GOief9LTUNNJoqqZn1A1-UiGRTXDag7_yODuxzpMFaAzbaisfK0gYti-PnjyHGWhpGwRplMKPPJk6rSAp1d9TWWXVgg-bNqUzz4_sr33ICJTx7_qZzfamMqk5PDZbHOwpIj8L2DBfo3isvt6QliWmgFEOuvog",
    "refresh_token": ""

```

```bash

174.tool_description:
'PurgoMalum' is a simple, free, RESTful web service for filtering and removing content of profanity, obscenity and other unwanted text. PurgoMalum's interface accepts several parameters for customization and can return results in plain text, XML and JSON.

This tool has 2 APIs:
1. 'Remove profanity' can remove profanity, obscenity and other unwanted text from an input text. It accepts additional parameters for customizing the profanity list and replacement text.
2. 'Check if text contains profanity' can check whether an input text contains profanity, obscenity and other unwanted text.

Please note that: The API usage description you output MUST follow the format of the example mentioned above, i.e.,
```
'{tool_name}' can {The function of the tool}.
This tool has N APIs: 
1. '{API name}' can {The function of the API}. 
2. '{API name}' can {The function of the API}. 
3. '{API name}' can {The function of the API}. 
```

Remove profanity.name: Remove profanity
Remove profanity.description: Calling the web service involves a simple HTTP GET request. The only two requirements for using PurgoMalum are the "text" parameter on the query string and the request-type name as part of the path in the request

optional_parameters.name: add
optional_parameters.description: A comma separated list of words to be added to the profanity list. Accepts letters, numbers, underscores (_) and commas (,). Accepts up to 10 words (or 200 maximum characters in length). The PurgoMalum filter is case-insensitive, so the case of you entry is not important.

optional_parameters.name: fill_text
optional_parameters.description: Text used to replace any words matching the profanity list. Accepts letters, numbers, underscores (_) tildes (~), exclamation points (!), dashes/hyphens (-), equal signs (=), pipes (|), single quotes ('), double quotes ("), asterisks (*), open and closed curly brackets ({ }), square brackets ([ ]) and parentheses (). Maximum length of 20 characters. When not used, the default is an asterisk (*) fill.

optional_parameters.name: fill_char
optional_parameters.description: Single character used to replace any words matching the profanity list. Fills designated character to length of word replaced. Accepts underscore (_) tilde (~), dash/hyphen (-), equal sign (=), pipe (|) and asterisk (*). When not used, the default is an asterisk (*) fill.

Example.Scenario: if you want to remove profanity from the input text 'This is some test input' and replace it with the fill text '****' and add words 'badword' and 'vulgarword' to the profanity list
check if the given text contains profanity

180.tool_description:
'Jibber Jabber' can generate random text content such as sentences, paragraphs and words. 
This tool has 5 APIs:
1. '/sentence' can return a single random sentence.
2. '/paragraph' can return a paragraph with random sentences.
3. '/words' can return random words.
4. '/sentences' can return some random sentences.
5. '/word' can return a random word.

Example.Scenario: generate a single random sentence
generate a paragraph with at least 10 words and 3 sentences
if you want to generate 10 random words with minimum length of 3 and maximum length of 8
if you want to get a single random sentence with a minimum word length of 5 and a maximum of 10 words
if you want to generate a random word with a minimum length of 5 and a maximum length of 8

190.tool_description:
'Flaticon' can provide 5M+ icons and vectors at your fingertips.
This tool has 14 APIs:
1. 'style' can allow you to get detailed information about a style, the design format that an icon or a pack has. Styles are the different versions in which an icon a given family may appear. 
2. 'category' can allow you to get detailed information about a category. Categories are the different themes in which icons are grouped at Flaticon.
3. 'totalPacks' can allow you to get a number stating the full quantity of packs available at Flaticon. The number refreshes periodically according to the content available at flaticon.com.
4. 'categories' can allow you to get a paged list with information about Flaticon categories. Categories are the different themes in which icons are grouped at Flaticon.
5. 'totalPacksPremium' can allow you to get a number stating the full quantity of PREMIUM packs available at Flaticon. The number refreshes periodically according to the content available at flaticon.com. 
6. 'download' can allow you to download the selected icon with the selected format.
7. 'tags' can allow you to get a paged list with information about Flaticon tags that icons or packs have.
8. 'tag' can allow you go get detailed information about a tag.
9. 'totalPacksSelection' can allow you to get a number stating the full quantity of SELECTION packs available at Flaticon. The number refreshes periodically according to the content available at flaticon.com. 
10. 'totalIconsSelection' can allow you to get a number stating the full quantity of SELECTION icons available at Flaticon. The number refreshes periodically according to the content available at flaticon.com.
11. 'searchPacks' can allow you to get a paged list with the results of the search. Packs returned by the search may be SELECTION packs or PREMIUM packs, according to the content.
12. 'searchIcons' can allow you to get a paged list with the results of the search. Icons returned by the search may be SELECTION icons or PREMIUM icons.
13. 'pack' can allow you to get detailed information about a pack. A pack is a set of icons that share a theme. Besides, any given pack may be found in one or many styles associated or not with a family.
14. 'packs' can allow you to get a paged list with information about the packs available at Flaticon. A pack is a set of icons that share a theme. Besides, any given pack may be found in one or many styles associated or not with a family.

style.name: style
style.description: Method that allows you go get detailed information about a style, the design format that an icon or a pack has. Styles are the different versions in which an icon a given family may appear. For example, an icon may be available in lineal, color, or lineal color styles.

Example.Scenario: if you want to get detailed information about the style with ID 12345

category.name: category
category.description: Method that allows you to get detailed information about a category. Categories are the different themes in which icons are grouped at Flaticon.

Example.Scenario: if you want to get detailed information about a category with ID 1234

totalPacks.name: totalPacks
totalPacks.description: Method that allows you to get a number stating the full quantity of packs available at Flaticon. The number refreshes periodically according to the content available at flaticon.com. Packs are sorted into two groups: PREMIUM packs and SELECTION packs. PREMIUM packs are those that contain one or more PREMIUM icons.

Example.Scenario: get the total number of packs available at Flaticon

categories.name: categories
categories.description: Method that allows you to get a paged list with information about Flaticon categories. Categories are the different themes in which icons are grouped at Flaticon.

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Page about which the request is made. In case it doesn’t exist, it will return page 1.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Number of max. authors returned per request. In case it isn’t requested, it will return 100 categories by default.

Example.Scenario: get the first page of categories with a limit of 50 categories per request

totalPacksPremium.name: totalPacksPremium
totalPacksPremium.description: Method that allows you to get a number stating the full quantity of PREMIUM packs available at Flaticon. The number refreshes periodically according to the content available at flaticon.com. PREMIUM packs are those that contain one or more PREMIUM icons.

Example.Scenario: Get the total number of premium packs available at Flaticon

download.name: download
download.description: Method that allows you to download the selected icon with the selected format.

required_parameters.name: format
required_parameters.description: Item format to download. Is possible to choose between 'svg' and 'png' formats. If no format is sent, it will return the item in 'png' format.

optional_parameters.name: color
optional_parameters.description: Monocolor Icons can be downloaded in different colors. Color property has to be a valid hexadecimal color. If no color is sent, it will return the icon in black.

optional_parameters.name: size
optional_parameters.description: Size to download the selected Icon. the valid sizes are: 16, 24, 32, 64, 128, 256, 512. If no size is sent it will return the icon with a size of 32px

Example.Scenario: if you want to download the icon with ID 123 in SVG format and color it in red with a size of 64px

tags.name: tags
tags.description: Method that allows you to get a paged list with information about Flaticon tags that icons or packs have.

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Page about which the request is made. In case it doesn’t exist, it will return page 1.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Number of max. authors returned per request. In case it isn’t requested, it will return 100 styles by default.

optional_parameters.name: havingStickers
optional_parameters.description: Get tags that have stickers

Example.Scenario: To get a paged list of Flaticon tags, with page number 2 and limit of 50 tags per request.

tag.name: tag
tag.description: Method that allows you go get detailed information about a tag.

Example.Scenario: if you want to get detailed information about tag with id 123

totalPacksSelection.name: totalPacksSelection
totalPacksSelection.description: Method that allows you to get a number stating the full quantity of SELECTION packs available at Flaticon. The number refreshes periodically according to the content available at flaticon.com. SELECTION packs are those that contain only SELECTION icons.

Example.Scenario: To get the total quantity of SELECTION packs available at Flaticon

totalIconsSelection.name: totalIconsSelection
totalIconsSelection.description: Method that allows you to get a number stating the full quantity of SELECTION icons available at Flaticon. The number refreshes periodically according to the content available at flaticon.com.

Example.Scenario: Get the total number of SELECTION icons available at Flaticon

searchPacks.name: searchPacks
searchPacks.description: Method that allows you to get a paged list with the results of the search. Packs returned by the search may be SELECTION packs or PREMIUM packs, according to the content.

required_parameters.name: orderBy
required_parameters.description:
Order by in results from Flaticon API. You can choose between order the results between 'priority' or 'added'. Priority order will return items ordered by an algorithm based on the downloads ratio. Added order will return items ordered by the date they were added to Flaticon.
For example: `https://api.flaticon.com/v2/search/packs/added?q=media&stroke=2&styleName=gradient&packId=1554346&limit=15`

201.tool_description:
'ViewDNS' can be used as a one-stop-shop for DNS related tools, including dns, info, reverse ip, pagerank, portscan, port scan, lookup, records, whois, ipwhois, dnstools, web hosting, hosting, traceroute, dns report, dnsreport, ip location, ip location finder, spam, spam database, dnsbl, propagation, dns propagation checker, checker, china, chinese, firewall, great firewall, is my site down, is site down, site down, down, dns propagate.
This tool has 13 APIs:
1. 'Whois' can display owner/contact information for a domain name. Can also be used to determine if a domain name is registered or not. This tool is not available to free API key users. Access is restricted to paid API keys only.
2. 'Port Scanner' can test whether common ports are open on a server. Useful in determining if a specific service (e.g. HTTP) is up or down on a specific server.
3. 'Traceroute' can determine the series of servers that data traverses from the ViewDNS server to the specified domain name or IP address.
4. 'DNS Record Lookup' can view all configured DNS records (A, MX, CNAME etc.) for a specified domain name.
5. 'Ping' can test how long a response from remote system takes to reach the ViewDNS server. Useful for detecting latency issues on network connections.
6. 'IP Location Finder' can display geographic information about a supplied IP address including city, country, latitude, longitude and more.
7. 'Chinese Firewall Test' can check whether a site is blocked by the Great Firewall of China. This test checks across a number of servers from various locations in mainland China to determine if access to the site provided is possible from behind the Great Firewall of China. This test checks for symptoms of DNS poisoning, one of the more common methods used by the Chinese government to block access to websites.
8. 'Spam Database Lookup' can find out if your mail server is listed in any spam databases.
9. 'Free Email Lookup' can find out if a domain name provides free email addresses. Search is performed on a custom made list of thousands of known free email hosts.
10. 'MAC Address Lookup' can display the name of the company that manufactured a specific network device based on its MAC Address.
11. 'Abuse Contact Lookup' can be used to find the abuse contact address for a domain name. This is where you would send complaints about spam originating from that domain.
12. 'DNS Propagation Checker' can check whether recent changes to DNS entries have propagated to DNS servers all over the world. Useful in troubleshooting DNS issues that appear to be isolated to one geographic region. Provides a status report on DNS propagation globally.
13. 'Iran Firewall Test' can test if any website is accessible using the Internet in Iran in real-time.

Whois.name: Whois

required_parameters.name: domain

Example.Scenario: if you want to perform a whois lookup on the domain name 'example.com' and get the output in JSON format

Example.Scenario: to scan common ports for a server with IP address 192.168.0.1 and get the output in JSON format

207.tool_description:
'Scanova QR Code' can generate custom-designed Branded QR Codes in bulk programmatically in your own mobile application or information system within few minutes.
This tool has 9 APIs:
1. 'SMS QR Code' can return a Static QR Code (standard or custom-designed) encoded with the recipient phone number and pre-loaded message. When scanned, the QR Code will prompt the scanning device to 'send SMS' pre-loaded with the recipient number and message. 
2. 'Email QR Code' can return a Static QR Code (standard or custom-designed) encoded with the email address. When scanned, the QR Code will prompt the user to 'send an email' to the specified email address.
3. 'Phone Call QR Code' can return a Static QR Code (standard or custom-designed) encoded with the phone number. When scanned, the QR Code will prompt the scanning device to 'dial the number'.
4. 'Google Map QR Code' can return a Static QR Code (standard or custom-designed) encoded with a Google Maps URL linked to specified map coordinates. When scanned, the QR Code prompts the scanning device to open the URL in a mobile browser or Google Maps mobile application (if installed).
5. 'Wifi QR Code' can return a Static QR Code (standard or custom-designed) encoded with WiFi network details. When scanned, the QR Code prompts the scanning device to 'Join the Network'. Note that this QR Code works only for Android devices. iPhones do not allow automatic joining of WiFi networks and will display network details as text.
6. 'Text QR Code' can return a Static QR Code (standard or custom-designed) encoded with specified text. When scanned, the QR Code prompts the scanning device to display the text. 
7. 'V-Card QR Code' can return a Static QR Code (standard or custom-designed) encoded with specified contact information. When scanned, the QR Code prompts the scanning device to 'Save as Contact'. 
8. 'Website URL QR Code' can return a Static QR Code (standard or custom-designed) encoded with a specified URL. 
9. 'API name' can {The function of the API}.

SMS QR Code.name: SMS QR Code
SMS QR Code.description: This request returns a Static QR Code (standard or custom-designed) encoded with the recipient phone number and pre-loaded message. When scanned, the QR Code will prompt the scanning device to 'send SMS' pre-loaded with the recipient number and message.

Example.Scenario: if you want to generate a standard QR code with recipient phone number 9123456789 and pre-loaded message 'Welcome to QR Code World!' with default parameters

Email QR Code.name: Email QR Code
Email QR Code.description: This request returns a Static QR Code (standard or custom-designed) encoded with the email address. When scanned, the QR Code will prompt the user to 'send an email' to the specified email address.

Example.Scenario: if you want to generate a custom-designed static QR code with the email address 'marketing@scanova.io' encoded in it with a black outer eye color and a rectangular data pattern

Phone Call QR Code.name: Phone Call QR Code
Phone Call QR Code.description: This request returns a Static QR Code (standard or custom-designed) encoded with the phone number. When scanned, the QR Code will prompt the scanning device to 'dial the number'.

Example.Scenario: if you want to generate a custom-designed Phone Call QR Code with the phone number 9123456789 with specific parameters

Google Map QR Code.name: Google Map QR Code
Google Map QR Code.description: This request returns a Static QR Code (standard or custom-designed) encoded with a Google Maps URL linked to specified map coordinates. When scanned, the QR Code prompts the scanning device to open the URL in a mobile browser or Google Maps mobile application (if installed)

Example.Scenario: if you want to generate a custom-designed Branded QR Code linked to the Google Maps URL with the specified coordinates (77.0364, 38.8951) with a medium size, inner eye color black, outer eye color white, error correction level M, data pattern RECT, eye pattern RECT_RECT, data gradient style None, data gradient start color black, data gradient end color black and white background color

Wifi QR Code.name: Wifi QR Code
Wifi QR Code.description: This request returns a Static QR Code (standard or custom-designed) encoded with WiFi network details. When scanned, the QR Code prompts the scanning device to 'Join the Network'. Note that this QR Code works only for Android devices. iPhones do not allow automatic joining of WiFi networks and will display network details as text.

Example.Scenario: if you want to generate a custom-designed Branded QR Code with WiFi network details for the 'Office-Office' network with default parameters

Text QR Code.name: Text QR Code

required_parameters.name: destination

optional_parameters.name: last
optional_parameters.description: The id of the last domain you fetched, see Infinite Scrolling section

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: How many branded domains to load

optional_parameters.name: orderDir
optional_parameters.description: Sorting direction to apply to your branded short links collection among desc and asc.

234.tool_description:
'IoTVAS' can detect IoT devices in the network and provide detailed firmware risk analysis without requiring the user to upload the firmware file.
This tool has 6 APIs:
1. 'get_accounts' can retrieve the list of OS accounts in the firmware.
2. 'get_weak_certs' can obtain the list of weak certificates found in the firmware.
3. 'get_expired_certs' can retrieve the list of expired certificates found in the firmware.
4. 'get_weak_keys' can obtain the list of weak cryptographic keys found in the firmware.
5. 'get_config_issues' can retrieve the list of configuration issues found in the firmware.
6. 'get_risk' can provide the firmware risk analysis, including the qualitative risk levels of network services, crypto libraries, kernel, and client tools in the analyzed firmware, as well as the details of vulnerable firmware components.

Example.Scenario: if you want to get account information for a device with firmware hash af88b1aaac0b222df8539f3ae1479b5c8eaeae41f1776b5dd2fa805cb33a1175
if you want to get weak certificates for a device with firmware hash 52841661d61e00649451cc471e9b56d169df8041926b1252bb3fd0710c27b12c
if you want to get expired certificates for a firmware with hash ac7c090c34338ea6a3b335004755e24578e7e4eee739c5c33736f0822b64907e

Text QR Code.name: Text QR Code
Text QR Code.description: This endpoint allows you to create a QR Code containing any text, in particular, an URL that may redirect the user to the website. After QR code is scanned, website will be displayed to the user.

Upload image.name: Upload image
Upload image.description: This endpoint allows you to upload images to LinQR storage. In the response, metadata of the submitted image is sent, including the identifier used by other endpoints from the `Image management` group for image identification.

required_parameters.name: image
required_parameters.description: Binary file to be uploaded into LinQR storage. Maximum single file size is 1MiB (1,048,576 bytes).

Contact QR Code.name: Contact QR Code
Contact QR Code.description: This endpoint allows you to create a QR Code that allows user to quickly add contact information to the phone book. The code contains an appropriately encoded electronic business card. After scanning, the device prompts to save the contact in the phone book.

Geolocation QR Code.name: Geolocation QR Code
Geolocation QR Code.description: This endpoint allows you to create a QR Code that allows to share location with the user. The code contains appropriately encoded geographic coordinates. After scanning the code, device maps application is invoked, pointing to the selected location (address).

Telephone QR Code.name: Telephone QR Code
Telephone QR Code.description: This endpoint allows you to create a QR Code that allows user to make quick telephone call. The code contains appropriately encoded telephone number. After scanning the code, device dialer is invoked with prefilled phone number. To make a call, the user only needs to press the green phone key.

Cryptocurrency payment QR Code.name: Cryptocurrency payment QR Code
Cryptocurrency payment QR Code.description: This endpoint allows you to create a QR Code that allows user to make a quick cryptocurrency transfer. The code contains appropriately encoded data for the payment. After scanning the code, the cryptocurrency wallet application asks user to perform the transfer without rewriting all necessary data.

SMS QR Code.name: SMS QR Code
SMS QR Code.description: This endpoint allows you to create a QR Code that allows user to quickly send SMS. The code contains appropriately encoded recipient number and message template. After scanning the code, device message application is invoked with prefilled phone number and text, ready to be sent. To send a SMS, the user only needs to press *Send* button.

WiFi QR Code.name: WiFi QR Code
WiFi QR Code.description: This endpoint allows you to create a QR Code that allows user to quickly connect to a WiFi network. The code contains properly encoded network credentials. After scanning, the device can automatically connect to the network without having to enter the password manually.

Arbitrary data type QR Code.name: Arbitrary data type QR Code
Arbitrary data type QR Code.description: This endpoint aggregates the functionality of all other endpoints in the group. The data type in the `data` field is recognized automatically and the data is encoded in an appropriate way.

Email QR Code.name: Email QR Code
Email QR Code.description: This endpoint allows the creation of a QR Code allowing the user to quickly send an email. The code contains an appropriately encoded message template. After scanning, the device starts the e-mail client with pre-filled specified fields.

data.subject: Example subject
data.body:
Example message body for Email QRCode.

Regards,
LinQR

QR Code Batch.name: QR Code Batch
QR Code Batch.description: This endpoint allows you to generate an archive containing multiple QR Codes with a single request. The endpoint response is the archive containing the generated image files and `items.json` file which is a record of the specifications of each of the files in the archive.
