2. 'Get User Data' can fetch user data by their ID. Automatically handles rate limits and bypasses them and it parses their creation date automatically.

Get Invite Data.name: Get Invite Data
Get Invite Data.description: Fetches detailed data, including hidden data of invites or vanities

Example.Scenario: if you want to get detailed data of the invite with the code `minecraft`

Get User Data.name: Get User Data
Get User Data.description: Fetches user data by their ID. Automatically handles rate limits and bypasses them and it parses their creation date automatically

245.tool_description:
'Arespass' is a password analyzer that calculates its entropy and shows a complete report that includes the password fragments having low randomness. Among the analysis carried out are multi-language word search, keyboard sequence search or irregular entropy distribution, to mention some of them. 
This tool has 2 APIs:
1. '/about' provides metadata about Arespass. 
2. '/ec' analyzes the password and returns a detailed report about its entropy and other characteristics.

optional_parameters.name: outputFormat
optional_parameters.description:
**The format of the returned metadata.**

Allowed values are *json*, *xml* and *yaml*.

The default value is *xml*.

Example.Scenario: Get information about the Arespass API Tool in JSON format

required_parameters.name: password
required_parameters.description:
**The password to be analyzed.**

Minimum length is 4 characters; maximum length is 128 characters.

Beware that certain characters like '#', '=' or '?' must be properly encoded.

For more information about this issue, please refer to RFC 3986 ("*Uniform Resource Identifier (URI): Generic Syntax*"), sections 2.1, 2.2 and 2.4.

optional_parameters.name: penalty
optional_parameters.description:
**The penalty applied to each character that is part of a word, number sequence, alphabet sequence, etc.**

The penalty is a float number in the range [0, 1]. Full penalty, 0; no penalty, 1.

The character used as decimal separator is always '.'. Hence, a parameter value like *0,33* would be illegal.

The default value is *0.25*.

optional_parameters.name: outputFormat
optional_parameters.description:
**The format of the returned analysis.**

Allowed values are *json*, *xml* and *yaml*.

The default value is *xml*.

optional_parameters.name: reqId
optional_parameters.description:
**An identifier for this request.**

The request identifier is a string that must match the regular expression */(?i)^[a-z0-9]{8,16}$/*.

This identifier is echoed in the returned response. Its value has no effect on the password analysis.

If this parameter is unset, a randomly generated identifier will be automatically assigned to this request.

Example.Scenario: if you want to analyze the password 'password123' with a penalty of 0.5, and output the analysis in JSON format with a request identifier of 'abcd1234'

251.tool_description:
'OTT details' can provide streaming details of movies and TV shows from 150+ streaming platforms in the US and India such as HBO, YouTube, Netflix, Prime Video, Hotstar, Hulu, etc. Additionally, it provides basic details on any given movie title.
This tool has 7 APIs:
1. 'Advanced Search' allows you to search for a movie or TV show based on various parameters such as release year, IMDb rating, genre, language, etc.
2. 'Basic Info' can give you information on a cast such as name, profession, birth and death year, bio, poster, best titles, etc.
3. 'Params' can get an array of values that can be used as parameters in Advanced Search.
4. 'Search' allows you to search for a movie or TV show based on the given 'title'.
5. 'Title Details' can provide basic information on a movie or TV show such as IMDb ID, title, genre, runtime, IMDb rating, language, synopsis, type, image URL, streaming platform info, etc.
6. 'Additional Title Details' can get additional details for a movie or TV show like reviews, quotes, plot summary, number of votes, trailer URL, cast details, etc.
7. 'New Arrivals' can get the latest arrivals from different platforms.

Generate avatar.name: Generate avatar
Generate avatar.description: Generates the desired avatar and returns the image to the client.

optional_parameters.name: randomizer
optional_parameters.description:
The default browser behavior is to cache responses that return from the same endpoint.
If your images are all returning the same, pass this param with ANY value to ensure you bypass this default behaviour and get random images for every request.

optional_parameters.name: text-color
optional_parameters.description:

Example.Scenario: generate an avatar with name 'Alice', background color of #00FF00, and randomizer to bypass caching

260.tool_description:
'Watchmode' can provide information about various OTT streaming services such as Netflix, HBO Max, Peacock, Hulu, Amazon Prime Video, AppleTV+, Disney+ & over 100 more. 
This tool has 17 APIs:
1. 'Title Episodes' can return all of the episodes for a TV series or mini-series, as well as the streaming sources each episode is available on.
2. 'Autocomplete Search' can search for titles/and or people by name or a partial name. 
3. 'Streaming Release Dates' can provide a listing of recently released or coming soon releases on the major streaming services.
4. 'Search' can search for titles or people using an external ID (IMDB, TheMovieDB.org), or by name. 
5. 'Person' can return details on a specific person (actor, director, etc).
6. 'List Titles' can provide a listing of titles that match certain parameters.
7. 'Regions' can return a listing of all regions (countries) that Watchmode currently supports and their 2 letter country codes used in the return data of other endpoints.
8. 'Sources' can return a listing of all streaming sources that Watchmode supports.
9. 'Genres' can return a mapping of genre names and IDs.
10. 'New Titles' can provide a listing of the title IDs of new titles added to Watchmode within the date range.
11. 'Networks' can return a listing of all TV networks that may be returned for a title in the /title endpoint.
12. 'Title Details' can get the details for a specific title, using the Watchmode universal ID.
13. 'Title Seasons' can return all of the seasons for a TV show or mini-series.
14. 'Title Streaming Sources' can get all of the streaming sources a title is available on and direct links to watch the title.
15. 'Title Cast & Crew' can return all people associated with the title, the "cast" (actors), and "crew" (directors, writers, cinematographers, etc).
16. 'Titles with Changed Sources' can provide a listing of titles that have changed to their streaming sources within the date range.
17. 'Titles with Changed Episodes' can provide a listing of titles that have had a change to their basic details (overview, cast, genres, ratings, etc) within the date range.

Title Episodes.name: Title Episodes
Title Episodes.description: Return all of the episodes for a TV series or mini-series, as well as the streaming sources each episode is available on.

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description:
This ID can be the Watchmode ID of the title (returned by other endpoints such as the list-titles endpoint), or found in the mapping file: https://api.watchmode.com/datasets/title_id_map.csv.

You can also pass an IMDB ID here instead, or a TMDB type and TMDB ID combination. For example, the TMDB combination for The Shawshank Redemption is movie-278 and for Breaking Bad is tv-1396.

Example.Scenario: if you want to get all episodes and their streaming sources for the TV series with ID 3173903

Autocomplete Search.name: Autocomplete Search
Autocomplete Search.description: Search for titles/and or people by name or a partial name. Useful for building an autocomplete search of titles and/or people. The results include the field result_type to indicate which type of result it is (title or person). For titles, the movie poster will be returned in image_url, for a person a headshot will be returned in image_url.

required_parameters.name: search_value
required_parameters.description: The phrase to search for, can be a full title or person name, or a partial phrase. For example searching for \"The sha\" will find the movie \"The Shawshank Redemption\".

optional_parameters.name: search_type
optional_parameters.description: Set this to 1 to include titles and people in results. Set this to 2 to include titles only. Set this to 3 to include movies only. Set this to 4 to include TV only. Set this to 5 to include people only. By default this is set to 1.

Example.Scenario: if you want to search for movies and TV shows related to 'Breaking Bad'

Streaming Release Dates.name: Streaming Release Dates
Streaming Release Dates.description: Get a listing of recently released or coming soon releases on the major streaming services. Only major services and US releases dates included, however most of the major services (Netflix, Hulu, etc) release original content on the same days in all countries they support. We return is_original field to indicate wheter the title is an original release on that streaming service.

optional_parameters.name: start_date
optional_parameters.description: By default, this endpoint will return release dates from the current date through the next 30 days. Populate this parameter to manually set a start date to include releases from a specific date range, format is YYYYMMDD (eg 20210101 for January 1st, 2021), or for more granular results down to the second YYYYMMDDHHMMSS (eg 20210101123459 for January 1st, 2021 12:24pm and 59 seconds). Hours are in 24 hour format and in Eastern Standard Time. Month, day, hour, minutes and seconds use leading zeros for single digit values.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Set how many release dates to return, default is 500.

optional_parameters.name: end_date
optional_parameters.description: By default, this endpoint will return release dates from the current date through the next 30 days. Populate this parameter to manually set a end date to include releases from a specific date range, format is YYYYMMDD (eg 20210101 for January 1st, 2021), or for more granular results down to the second YYYYMMDDHHMMSS (eg 20210101123459 for January 1st, 2021 12:24pm and 59 seconds). Hours are in 24 hour format and in Eastern Standard Time. Month, day, hour, minutes and seconds use leading zeros for single digit values.

Example.Scenario: Get recently released or coming soon releases on the major streaming services from March 1, 2022 through March 12, 2022 with limit of 250 releases

Search.name: Search
Search.description: Search for titles or people using an external ID (IMDB, TheMovieDB.org), or by name. Returns an array of results objects, that can either be a title or a person. Useful for getting the Watchmode IDs for titles and people. For example, you can set the parameters to search_value=Breaking%20Bad and search_field=name to get all of the titles named "Breaking bad", and then use the IDs returned in other endpoints such as /v1/title/

required_parameters.name: search_field
required_parameters.description:
The field for us to search in, either a 3rd party ID or \\\"name\\\" which will search for a movie/show title or a person's name depending on the type(s) set. Must be one of the following options:
imdb_id, tmdb_person_id, tmdb_movie_id, tmdb_tv_id, name.

required_parameters.name: search_value
required_parameters.description: The value we should search for. For example, if you set search_field to imdb_id, this would be the IMDB title/person ID, eg. tt0944947.

optional_parameters.name: types
optional_parameters.description:
Pass one of the following values, or multiple comma separated values to only return certain types:
tv, movie, person.

Example.Scenario: if you want to search for the title 'Breaking Bad' by name

Person.name: Person
Person.description: Return details on a specific person (actor, director, etc).

Example.Scenario: if you want to get details on a specific person with id 7110004

List Titles.name: List Titles
List Titles.description:
Get a listing of titles that match certain parameters. This powerful endpoint can allow you to find many combinations of titles. For example you could search for something as granular "Horror Movies Streaming on Netflix in the USA" by using the genres, types, source_ids and regions parameters.

Results are paginated, and return 250 pages per query by default. Useful for mapping all Watchmode title IDs in your app, and finding in bulk what titles are available in different countries, different sources or source types.

Streaming sources are limited to USA only for free plans.

optional_parameters.name: genres
optional_parameters.description: Filter results to only include certain genre(s). Pass in a single genre id (which you would get from the /v1/genres/ endpoint, or multiple comma separated.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Set how many titles to return per page, default and maximum is 250.

optional_parameters.name: source_ids
optional_parameters.description:
Pass an individual ID for a source (returned from the /sources/ endpoint) to filter the results to titles available on that source. Pass multiple values comma separated to return titles available on one of the sources you pass in.
Note: If you populate this you can only set a single region, and if you set no region US will be set by default.

optional_parameters.name: source_types
optional_parameters.description:
Filter results to only include titles that are available on a specific type(s) of source (such a subscription, or TV Everywhere channel apps, etc). By default all are selected, pass one or multiple (comma delimited) of these values: sub, rent, buy, free, tve
Note: If you populate this you can only set a single region, and if you set no region US will be set by default.

optional_parameters.name: types
optional_parameters.description: Filter result to only include certain types of titles. Pass a single type or pass multiple types comma delimited. Possible values: movie, tv_series, tv_special, tv_miniseries, short_film

optional_parameters.name: regions
optional_parameters.description:
Pass one of the region values (eg. US), or multiple regions comma delimited to only return sources active in those regions. Currently supported regions: US, GB, CA, AU
Note: If you populate the source_ids or source_types you can only set a single region, and if you set no region US will be set by default.

optional_parameters.name: sort_by
optional_parameters.description: Sort order of results, possible values: relevance_desc, relevance_asc, popularity_desc, popularity_asc, release_date_desc, release_date_asc, title_desc, title_asc. Default value is: relevance_desc.

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Set the page of results you want to return, if this isn't set you will always get page 1 returned.

optional_parameters.name: network_ids
optional_parameters.description: Pass an individual ID for a TV network (returned from the /networks/ endpoint) to filter the results to titles the originally aired on that TV network. Pass multiple values comma separated to return titles that aired on one of the networks you passed in.

optional_parameters.name: release_date_start
optional_parameters.description: Set the start of a range for when the title was released (the initial release of the movie or show, not necessarily when it was released on a streaming service). For example, to only include releases on or after January 1, 2001 set this to 20010101

optional_parameters.name: release_date_end
optional_parameters.description: Set the end of a range for when the title was released (the initial release of the movie or show, not necessarily when it was released on a streaming service). For example, to only include releases on or before December 11, 2020 set this to 20201211

Example.Scenario: if you want to get a list of movies and TV shows that are horror genre and available on Netflix and Hulu in the US

Regions.name: Regions
Regions.description: Return a listing of all regions (countries) that Watchmode currently supports and their 2 letter country codes used in the return data of other endpoints.

Example.Scenario: Get a listing of all regions and their 2 letter country codes

Sources.name: Sources
Sources.description: Return a listing of all streaming sources that Watchmode supports. Optionally filter by type of source (subscription, free, etc).

optional_parameters.name: regions
optional_parameters.description: Pass one of the region values (eg. US), or multiple regions comma delimited to only return sources active in those regions. Currently supported regions: US, GB, CA, AU

optional_parameters.name: types
optional_parameters.description:
Pass one of the following values, or multiple comma separated values to only return certain types of streaming sources:
sub, free, purchase, tve. \\\"sub\\\" means the service is a subscription service, \\\"tve\\\" means the service is a TV channel app.

Example.Scenario: if you want to get a listing of all streaming sources that Watchmode supports in Canada that are subscription-based

Genres.name: Genres
Genres.description: Return a mapping of genre names and IDs. Some genres have a tmdb_id, which is the corresponding genre ID on TheMovieDB.org API.

Example.Scenario: To get the mapping of genre names and IDs

New Titles.name: New Titles
New Titles.description: Get a listing of the title IDs of new titles added to Watchmode within the date range. You can use this to find new titles, then use the /v1/title/ endpoint to get details on the title.

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Set the page of results you want to return, if this isn't set you will always get page 1 returned.

optional_parameters.name: types
optional_parameters.description: Filter result to only include certain types of titles. Pass a single type or pass multiple types comma delimited. Possible values: movie, tv_series, tv_special, tv_miniseries, short_film

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Set how many titles to return per page, default and maximum is 250.

optional_parameters.name: end_date
optional_parameters.description: By default, the changes API will return changes since the beginning of yesterday. Populate this parameter to manually set a end date to include changes from a specific date range, format is YYYYMMDD (eg 20210101 for January 1st, 2021).

optional_parameters.name: start_date
optional_parameters.description: By default, the changes API will return changes since the beginning of yesterday. Populate this parameter to manually set a start date to include changes from a specific date range, format is YYYYMMDD (eg 20210101 for January 1st, 2021).

Example.Scenario: Get a listing of new movie and tv series titles added to Watchmode within the date range starting from 2022-01-01 and ending at 2022-01-31 and limit the results to 100 per page starting from page 3

Networks.name: Networks
Networks.description: Return a listing of all TV networks that may be returned for a title in the /title endpoint.

Example.Scenario: Get a listing of all TV networks that may be returned for a title using the Watchmode API

Title Details.name: Title Details
Title Details.description: Get the details for a specific title, using the Watchmode universal ID.

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description:
This ID can be the Watchmode ID of the title (returned by other endpoints such as the list-titles endpoint), or found in the mapping file: https://api.watchmode.com/datasets/title_id_map.csv.

You can also pass an IMDB ID here instead, or a TMDB type and TMDB ID combination. For example, the TMDB combination for The Shawshank Redemption is movie-278 and for Breaking Bad is tv-1396.

optional_parameters.name: language
optional_parameters.description: Two letter iso_639_1 language code. Return the title and plot overview in the language of your choosing (default is EN). If this is set, and not to EN, then an additional field called english_title will be returned with the title in English if available.

Example.Scenario: if you want to know the details of the title with Watchmode ID 3173903 in Spanish language

Title Seasons.name: Title Seasons
Title Seasons.description: Return all of the seasons for a TV show or mini-series.

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description:
This ID can be the Watchmode ID of the title (returned by other endpoints such as the list-titles endpoint), or found in the mapping file: https://api.watchmode.com/datasets/title_id_map.csv.

You can also pass an IMDB ID here instead, or a TMDB type and TMDB ID combination. For example, the TMDB combination for The Shawshank Redemption is movie-278 and for Breaking Bad is tv-1396.

Example.Scenario: if you want to get all seasons of the TV show with Watchmode ID 3173903

Titles with Changed Sources.name: Titles with Changed Sources
Titles with Changed Sources.description: Get a listing of titles that have changed to their streaming sources within the date range.

optional_parameters.name: start_date
optional_parameters.description: By default, the changes API will return changes since the beginning of yesterday. Populate this parameter to manually set a start date to include changes from a specific date range, format is YYYYMMDD (eg 20210101 for January 1st, 2021), or for more granular results down to the second YYYYMMDDHHMMSS (eg 20210101123459 for January 1st, 2021 12:24pm and 59 seconds). Hours are in 24 hour format and in Eastern Standard Time. Month, day, hour, minutes and seconds use leading zeros for single digit values.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Set how many titles to return per page, default and maximum is 250.

optional_parameters.name: end_date
optional_parameters.description: By default, the changes API will return changes since the beginning of yesterday. Populate this parameter to manually set a end date to include changes from a specific date range, format is YYYYMMDD (eg 20210101 for January 1st, 2021), or for more granular results down to the second YYYYMMDDHHMMSS (eg 20210101123459 for January 1st, 2021 12:24pm and 59 seconds). Hours are in 24 hour format and in Eastern Standard Time. Month, day, hour, minutes and seconds use leading zeros for single digit values.

optional_parameters.name: regions
optional_parameters.description: Pass in the 2 character region code (eg US) for the country you want to get titles with changed sources from. There is a limit to 1 region on this endpoint, if you leave this field blank US changes will be returned only.

optional_parameters.name: types
optional_parameters.description: Filter result to only include certain types of titles. Pass a single type or pass multiple types comma delimited. Possible values: movie, tv_series, tv_special, tv_miniseries, short_film

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Set the page of results you want to return, if this isn't set you will always get page 1 returned.

Example.Scenario: if you want to get a listing of titles that have changed to their streaming sources within the date range in Canada for movies and tv series, and limit the results to 100 per page

264.tool_description:
'Exerra phishing check' can check URLs to see whether they are known phishing attempts. 
This tool has 3 APIs:
1. 'Get stats' can get statistics about the Exerra Phishing API. 
2. 'Check a URL' can check if a URL is a known phishing attempt.
3. 'Get all' can get all domains (or links) associated with phishing attempts. The response is very large (>≈13MB), so it is preferred to use "Check a link". Due to the large response size (and processing) this endpoint is paid.

Get stats.name: Get stats
Get stats.description: Get statistics about the Exerra Phishing API

Example.Scenario: Get statistics about the Exerra Phishing API

Check a URL.name: Check a URL
Check a URL.description: Check if a URL is a known phishing attempt

required_parameters.name: url
required_parameters.description:
This is the URL that the API will check.
Must be a valid HTTP(s) URL or it will throw a 400

Example.Scenario: Check if the URL https://example.com is a known phishing attempt

Get all.name: Get all
Get all.description:
Get all domains (or links) associated with phishing attempts. The response is very large (>≈13MB), so it is preferred to use "Check a link". 

Due to the large response size (and processing) this endpoint is paid.

Example.Scenario: To get all domains associated with phishing attempts

RemoveEndpointData.name: RemoveEndpointData
RemoveEndpointData.description:
Remove an endpoint from you user account by Id.

(KNOWN ISSUE with RAPIDAPI)
Successfully deleting an enpoint will result with a 200, however it MAY provide an ERROR stating "src property must be a valid json object". This is an issue with RAPIDAPI and not our API.

Example.Scenario: if you want to remove an endpoint with id '1234' for user '5678'

GetEndpointData.name: GetEndpointData
GetEndpointData.description: This Endpoint retrieves the endpoint data from the specified UserId and EndpointId.

277.tool_description:
'oDesk APIs' can allow authorized users to access and build their own oDesk applications. 
This tool has 8 APIs: 
1. 'Get a specific task record' can return details on a specific oTask or set of oTasks, this format can be used within a company, team or user.
2. 'List all oTask records' can pull all tasks assigned within a company, team or to a specific user.
3. 'Get My Jobs' can return all jobs that a user has manage_recruiting access to. This API call can be used to find the reference ID of a specific job.
4. 'Generating Agency Specific Reports' can generate time reports for an agency.
5. 'Generating Company Wide Reports' can generate time reports on a company-wide level.
6. 'Get Specific Job' can return the complete job object for the referenced job.
7. 'Generating Provider Specific Reports' allows the caller to fetch data source of themselves.
8. 'Generate Time Reports for a Specific Team' can generate time reports for a specific team, with or without detailed monetary information based on the relationship of the authorized user at the time the call is made and what information is included in the call.

Get a specific task record.name: Get a specific task record
Get a specific task record.description: return details on a specific oTask or set of oTasks, this format can be used within a company (:companyid), team (:teamid) or user (:userid)

required_parameters.name: code1;code2;...;codeN
required_parameters.description: The specific task codes, the list of codes should be separated with ";"

required_parameters.name: username
required_parameters.description: The username of the target user account

Example.Scenario: if you want to get the details of the specific tasks with codes 12, 23 and 34 in XML format for user 'myuser' in company 12345 and team 45678

List all oTask records.name: List all oTask records
List all oTask records.description: returns all task records under the company

required_parameters.name: username
required_parameters.description: The username of the target user account

Example.Scenario: to list all oTask records under the company with ID 12345 in XML format, for the team with ID 45678 and for the target user account 'myuser'

Get My Jobs.name: Get My Jobs
Get My Jobs.description: Returns all jobs that a user has manage_recruiting access to. This API call can be used to find the reference ID of a specific job.

optional_parameters.name: include_sub_teams
optional_parameters.description: wether to include info about sub teams

optional_parameters.name: created_by
optional_parameters.description: The user ID

optional_parameters.name: status
optional_parameters.description: Status of Job

optional_parameters.name: created_time_from
optional_parameters.description: Filter from time

optional_parameters.name: created_time_to
optional_parameters.description: Filter to time

optional_parameters.name: page
optional_parameters.description: Pagination, formed as $offset;$count

optional_parameters.name: order_by
optional_parameters.description: Sorting

Example.Scenario: if you want to get all the jobs that the user with buyer team reference ID 34567 has access to, including sub team info, and sorted by job creation time

Generating Agency Specific Reports.name: Generating Agency Specific Reports
Generating Agency Specific Reports.description: Time reports can be generated for an agency, in order to use this API the authorized user needs staffing manager permissions to the agency.

required_parameters.name: format
required_parameters.description: note: format must be specified in tqx parameter, see example

required_parameters.name: tq
required_parameters.default: SELECT week_worked_on, assignment_team_id, provider_id, assignment_name, sum(hours), sum(earnings) WHERE worked_on > '2009-10-01' AND worked_on <= '2009-10-31

Example.Scenario: if you want to generate a time report in csv format for the agency with ID 67890 and the company with ID 12345 for the month of October 2009

Parameters.tq: SELECT week_worked_on, assignment_team_id, provider_id, assignment_name, sum(hours), sum(earnings) WHERE worked_on > '2009-10-01' AND worked_on <= '2009-10-31'

Generating Company Wide Reports.name: Generating Company Wide Reports
Generating Company Wide Reports.description: Time reports can be generated on a company-wide level. All time reports fields are supported on this level except earnings related fields. In order to access this API the authorized user needs either hiring or finance permissions to all teams within the company.

required_parameters.name: format
required_parameters.description: note: format must be specified in tqx parameter, see example

required_parameters.name: tq
required_parameters.default: SELECT week_worked_on, assignment_team_id, sum(hours), sum(charges) WHERE worked_on > '2009-10-01' AND worked_on <= '2009-10-31'

Example.Scenario: To generate a time report for company ID 12345 in JSON format for the month of October 2009

Parameters.tq: SELECT week_worked_on, assignment_team_id, sum(hours), sum(charges) WHERE worked_on > '2009-10-01' AND worked_on <= '2009-10-31'

Get Specific Job.name: Get Specific Job
Get Specific Job.description: Returns the complete job object for the referenced job, this is only available to users with manage_recruiting permissions within the team that the job is posted in.

Example.Scenario: if you want to get the complete job object for the job with job reference ID 12345 in JSON format

List all Tasks.name: List all Tasks
List all Tasks.description: pull all tasks assigned within a company, team or to a specific user

required_parameters.name: username
required_parameters.description: The username of the target user account.

Example.Scenario: to pull all tasks assigned to user 'myuser' within company '12345'

Generating Provider Specific Reports.name: Generating Provider Specific Reports
Generating Provider Specific Reports.description: This API allows callers to fetch data source of themselves. No monetary fields, such as charges or earnings, are supported. The caller of this API must be the provider himself.

required_parameters.name: format
required_parameters.description: note: format must be specified in tqx parameter, see example

required_parameters.name: tq
required_parameters.default: SELECT worked_on, assignment_team_id, hours, task, memo WHERE worked_on > '2009-10-01' AND worked_on <= '2009-10-31'

Example.Scenario: to generate a report in CSV format for provider with ID 68378 for the time period between October 1st, 2009 and October 31st, 2009

Parameters.tq: SELECT worked_on, assignment_team_id, hours, task, memo WHERE worked_on > '2009-10-01' AND worked_on <= '2009-10-31'

Generate Time Reports for a Specific Tea.name: Generate Time Reports for a Specific Team
Generate Time Reports for a Specific Tea.description: Time reports can be generated for a specific team, with or without detailed monetary information based on the relationship of the authorized user at the time the call is made and what information is included in the call.

required_parameters.name: format
required_parameters.description: note: format must be specified in tqx parameter, see example.

required_parameters.name: tq
required_parameters.default: SELECT worked_on, provider_id, provider_name, sum(hours) WHERE worked_on >= '2009-10-01' AND worked_on <= '2009-10-31'

Example.Scenario: if you want to generate time reports for the team with team ID 34567 in company with company ID 12345 in JSON format with the Google query 'SELECT worked_on, provider_id, provider_name, sum(hours) WHERE worked_on >= '2009-10-01' AND worked_on <= '2009-10-31'.'

Parameters.tq: SELECT worked_on, provider_id, provider_name, sum(hours) WHERE worked_on >= '2009-10-01' AND worked_on <= '2009-10-31'

Create an oTask record.name: Create an oTask record
Create an oTask record.description: New oTasks can be created using the API, when you create a new oTask you need to define a code, description and URL

required_parameters.name: code
required_parameters.description: A task tracking code (This defines the task tracking code)

required_parameters.name: description
required_parameters.description: The code's description (This should be a description about the code being added)

required_parameters.name: username
required_parameters.description: The username of the target user account

optional_parameters.name: url
optional_parameters.description: The location where more info on the code can be found (The URL can be used to direct the user to more info about the code being entered)

Invite to interview.name: Invite to interview
Invite to interview.description: Sends invitation to a specific user(s)

required_parameters.name: provider__reference
required_parameters.description: Developer's unique reference ID. Use it if no profile_key available

Post a Job.name: Post a Job
Post a Job.description: Posts one job with required parameters

required_parameters.name: buyer_team__reference
required_parameters.description: Reference ID of the buyer team that is posting the job

required_parameters.name: description
required_parameters.default: A new interesting start-up requires an API ecosystem, ...

optional_parameters.name: start_date
optional_parameters.description: The start date of the Job. If start_date is not included the job will default to starting immediately.

optional_parameters.name: end_date
optional_parameters.description: The end date of the Job. Only needed if job type is 'fixed-price'

optional_parameters.name: budget
optional_parameters.description: The budget of the Job. Used for 'fixed-price' jobs only.

optional_parameters.name: duration
optional_parameters.description: The duration of job in hours. Used for 'hourly-jobs' only.

278.tool_description:
'Mobile Phone Specs Database' can provide a comprehensive source of information for consumers to compare over 10,000 models of mobile phones, including device dimensions, images, weight, display size and type, processor, memory, storage, camera specifications, battery capacity, operating system, and connectivity options, among others. 
This tool has 6 APIs:
1. 'Get {Phone Image ids} by {Custom id}' can get up to 10 phone images (IDs) by phone custom ID. Use these IDs in the Endpoint: Get {Image} by {Phone Image ID}. The image IDs expire after 30 minutes.
2. 'Get {Specifications} by {Brand Name} and {Model Name}' can get all phone specifications by brand name and model name.
3. 'Get {Image} by {Phone Image id}' can get the image by ID. Paste the image ID from 'Get all phone image IDs by phone custom ID' and the image media content is returned.
4. 'Get {Specifications} by {Custom id}' can get all phone specifications by phone custom ID.
5. 'List all {Models} by {Phone Brand}' can list models by phone brand name.
6. 'List all {Phone Brands}' can list all phone brands.

Get {Phone Image ids} by {Custom id}.name: Get {Phone Image ids} by {Custom id}

Example.Scenario: if you want to get up to 10 phone images for the mobile phone with custom ID 103693

Get {Specifications} by {Brand Name} and.name: Get {Specifications} by {Brand Name} and {Model Name}
Get {Specifications} by {Brand Name} and.description: Get all phone specifications by brand name and model name

Example.Scenario: if you want to get the specifications of the Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra 5G mobile phone

Get {Image} by {Phone Image id}.name: Get {Image} by {Phone Image id}
Get {Image} by {Phone Image id}.description:
- Get Image by Id
- Paste image ID from this api "Get all phone image ids by phone custom id" and image media content is returned
- ex of image id : "Z2RjOG80Smk2WVV2R0wwR1F1RjRNZG5TR1ZqUUZuU1JhU1pNT0FjNG94UT0="

Example.Scenario: if you want to get an image of a mobile phone with the image ID Z2RjOG80Smk2WVV2R0wwR1F1RjRNZG5TR1ZqUUZuU1JhU1pNT0FjNG94UT0=

Get {Specifications} by {Custom id}.name: Get {Specifications} by {Custom id}
Get {Specifications} by {Custom id}.description: Get all phone specifications by phone custom id

Example.Scenario: if you want to get all the specifications of a mobile phone with custom ID 103693

List all {Models} by {Phone Brand}.name: List  all {Models} by {Phone Brand}
List all {Models} by {Phone Brand}.description: List Models By Phone Brand name

Example.Scenario: if you want to list all models of Samsung mobile phones
if you want to get a list of all phone brands

279.tool_description:
'Measurement Unit Converter' can help users convert measurements from one unit to another. This tool has 4 APIs:
1. 'Measurements' provides an enum array of all types of measurements. 
2. 'Convert from one unit to another' converts the given quantity in one unit to the equivalent quantity in another, for a given measurement, and returns a detailed answer. 
3. 'Measurements detailed' provides a list of all the available measurements with unit details. 
4. 'Measure units' provides an enum array of all units of the given type.

Convert from one unit to another.name: Convert from one unit to another
Convert from one unit to another.description: Converts the given quantity in one unit to the equivalent quantity in another, for a given measurement, and returns a detailed answer.

Example.Scenario: if you want to convert 1200 meters to kilometers

Measurements.name: Measurements
Measurements.description: GET enum array of all types of measurement

Example.Scenario: Get all types of measurements

Measurements detailed.name: Measurements detailed
Measurements detailed.description: GET a list of all the available measurements with unit details.

Example.Scenario: To get a list of all available measurements with unit details

Measure units.name: Measure units
Measure units.description: GET enum array of all units of the given type.

Example.Scenario: if you want to get the enum array of all units for length

280.tool_description:
'All Purpose Complex Converter' can convert numbers to words, text to speech, numbers to speech, speech to text and much more.
This tool has 4 APIs:
1. 'Convert Number To Speech| Provide Any Integer Number' can convert any integer number to speech.
2. 'Convert Text To Speech || Provide Any Text' can convert any text to speech.
3. 'Convert Numbers To Words | Provide Any Integer Number' can convert any number to words.
4. 'GET Languages' can provide the list of all the supported languages.

Convert Number To Speech| Provide Any In.name: Convert Number To Speech| Provide Any Integer Number
Convert Number To Speech| Provide Any In.description: Converting any integer number to Speech

optional_parameters.name: lang
optional_parameters.description:
Select Language , By default  ( en-us ) is supported, 
Hit GET Languages Endpoint to get a list of all supported languages.

Example.Scenario: if you want to convert the number 12345345483453456434354131 to speech in French

Convert Text To Speech || Provide Any Te.name: Convert Text To Speech || Provide Any Text

required_parameters.name: text
required_parameters.description:
Support Both Text and Numbers. 
Can Pass Text Such as (\"any Thing to convert\")
or 
Can Pass Any Number such as 1029383833384474
required_parameters.default: I am using All Purpose Complex Converter API for My Daily Tasks.

optional_parameters.name: lang
optional_parameters.description:
Select Language , By default  ( en-us ) is supported, 
Hit GET Languages Endpoint to get a list of all supported languages.

Example.Scenario: if you want to convert the text 'Hello World' to speech in French

Convert Numbers To Words | Provide Any I.name: Convert Numbers To Words | Provide Any Integer Number

optional_parameters.name: to_convert
optional_parameters.description: By Default the number will be converted to cardinal, if you wan to convert it into specific format such as ordinal, ordinal_num, year or currency than you can specify it here.

Example.Scenario: if you want to convert the number 2356564546548979878435435453456464 to ordinal format
Get all the supported languages

281.tool_description:
'HackerRank' can run codes in many different languages. 
This tool has 1 API:
1. 'Languages' provides information regarding the language codes which the HackerRank code checker supports.

Languages.name: Languages
Languages.description: This method provides you with information regarding the language codes which our code checker supports

Example.Scenario: get the list of all the programming languages supported by HackerRank

Code checker.name: Code checker
Code checker.description: Allows users to use the HackerRank code checker for their own purposes. Submit source code, which is compiled and run against a list of provided test cases.

required_parameters.name: source
required_parameters.description: The source code to be submitted

required_parameters.name: lang
required_parameters.description: An integer code of the language

required_parameters.name: testcases
required_parameters.description: A JSON encoded list of strings each being a test case

required_parameters.name: callback_url
required_parameters.description: A callback url, on which the submission response will be posted as a JSON string under `data` parameter

required_parameters.name: wait
required_parameters.description: Wait for the submission to be processed in the request. If set to `false`, the request returns immidiately and submission response will posted through the callback URL.

required_parameters.name: format
required_parameters.description: Output format as JSON or XML

282.tool_description:
'Disposable Email Checker' is a API tool which can help you check if an email address is disposable or valid to avoid fake users in your database. 
This tool has 1 API:
1. 'Email Validation' can validate if an email address is disposable or not based on the domain name.

Example.Scenario: Check if the email address is disposable or valid for the domain 'gmail.com'
